result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard K McDaniel

defendant.name: McDaniel, Richard K
defendant.address: 403 Jackson St, Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: showing jail credit in cases 13CF146, 13CF245, 13CF268, 14CF70, & 14CF137.
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Martinez.
filed by defendant and Atty Martinez.

Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called:  13CF268, 13CF146, 13CF245, 14CF70, & 14CF137.   Rights/Elements.  In 13CF268 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  In 14CF137 defendant plead no contest to Cts. 6 & 7.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 13CF268  withhold sentencing, placed on probation for 2 years.  90 days jail with Huber.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample and surcharge.  AODA and comply.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full, and successful completion of probation.  Jail start on 8/15/14 at 7:00 pm.   All other counts dismissed but read in.  In case 14CF137  withhold sentencing placed on probation for 2 years each count.  $443.00 costs, each count, for a total of $886.00.  AODA and comply.  All other counts dismissed but read in.  In 13CF146, 13CF245, 14CF70, all counts dismissed but read in.  Counsel is to write a stipulation for any jail credit due.
plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2014 at 9:30 a.m.
filed by Atty Yaskal

Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed in 14 CF 70 and 14 CF 137, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial, Atty Martinez states all matters are resolved, 13 CF 146, 13 CF 245, 13 CF 268, 14 CF 70, and 14 CF 137 to be set for plea/sentencing hearing
Preliminary hearing on July 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Cases heard 14CF70, 14CF137, 13CF245, 13CF146 & 13CF268, Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Martinez did not dispute finding that defendant is competent. State did not dispute. Court found defendant competent. 14CF70 & 14CF137 to be set for a preliminary hearings. Remaining cases to track with.
filed by Brad E.R. Smith, M.D.
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services filed

Cases heard: 14CF137, 14CF70, 13CF245, 13CF146 and 13CF268, Defendant Richard K McDaniel in custody with attorney Andrew I Martinez at the courthouse.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martinez requests competency evaluations be done. Court ordered competency evaluations be done in all cases.

Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the 
State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
